title: Simplifying
text: First, add the constant on both sides, to resemble the standard form. In this case, we add 199 to both sides.

title: Factor by Grouping
text: If possible, we then group the different variables, which in this case are x and y and factor their constants. In this case, we factor 9 from the x's and -16 from the y's.

title: Completing the Square
text: We then complete the square for both the variables, x and y.

title: Completing the Square
text: After completing the square, we have the equation, $$9{\left(x+1\right)}^2-16{\left(y-2\right)}^2=144$$

title: Simplification
text: To match it with the standard form, we then divide both sides to get 1, so in this case, we divide both sides by 36.
